info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 18 at 12:59PM CDT until September 20 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Aberdeen SD
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Dakota...
Bad River Near Fort Pierre affecting Stanley County.
.For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Bad River near Fort Pierre.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Bad River Road begins flooding about 7 miles upstream of the gauge At 24.0 feet, Water reaches mobile homes along Highway 83 south of Fort Pierre
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM CDT Thursday /11:30 AM MDT Thursday/ the stage was 20.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr.
The next statement will be issued by Friday evening at 700 PM CDT /600 PM MDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING
